definitions.definition: To dull the senses or capacity to think thereby reducing responsiveness ; to stun .
examples: He stupefied her by means of chloroform, a general anaesthetic.

definitions.definition: To astonish or stun , especially as a result of some distressing action.
examples: The police's negligence and callousness continued to stupefy her.

definitions.definition: To deprive a material of the ability to undergo change or movement, especially deformation .

main_definition: ( transitive , especially law ) To dull the senses or capacity to think thereby reducing responsiveness ; to stun .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , by extension , figurative ) To astonish or stun , especially as a result of some distressing action.
( transitive , obsolete ) To deprive a material of the ability to undergo change or movement, especially deformation .
